fields.description:
Referring to http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/Viewing+the+Activity+Stream

I've made small changes to the User Profile Section as it incorrectly stated that the stream was editable, and it omitted the fact that comments/updates by other users on wiki pages you have authored or are currently watching will show up. 

I might have missed something else so we should confirm and document what exactly the logic is (and review my changes to make sure it still makes sense :))
fields.summary: Improve documentation for User Profile Activity Streams - what will be included and when.

fields.description:
After the 1.8.1 upgrade, the header in the 'wiki' tab is broken on some Studio hosts:

!brokenwikiheader.png!

The Confluence logcs contain the message on startup:

2009-08-16 15:50:12.926730500 2009-08-16 15:50:12,918 ERROR [main] [atlassian.plugin.manager.PluginEnabler] enable Unable to start the following plugins: com.atlassian.studio.static
fields.summary: Wiki header formatting broken after 1.8.1 upgrade

fields.description: Hibernate configuration for SALProperty shouldn't use hibernate cache
fields.summary: SALPropertyDAOHibernate in crowd returns incorrect value.
Create a live test class to verify all approved customer requested plugins are present and enabled.

fields.description:
*Bamboo doesn't show projects that have no build plans.*
In studio we should display empty projects. There should also be a link - "Create a new plan"  for each project. 

*When you visit project with no build plan {{http://localhost:6990/builds/browse/DRBY}} it shows empty screen*
Only project name is shown. This screen should be improved and display some text saying..."There are no plans created in this project. Click here to create one"
fields.summary: Include projects with no plans in Bamboo dashboard

fields.description: See attached screenshot
fields.summary: Builds tab should not be highlighted in admin screens

fields.description:
Can't seem to find an issue that specifically addresses  this so creating a new one. 

The studio wide search doesn't have support for [smart queries| http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/quicksearch.html] as in JIRA. For instance I can't type {{JST open}} and get a list of the open JIRA Studio issues. 

Its possible to work around this by invoking the standard quick search JIRA action: 

* https://studio.atlassian.com/secure/QuickSearch.jspa?searchString=JST+open

But it would be nice if we could do this from the studio quick search as well.
fields.summary: Integrate JIRA's Smart Query features with the studio search

fields.description:
When you attach a file to a wiki page ({{/wiki/pages/viewpageattachments.action}}) if gives you an option to add a comment, however on Studio this comment is not being saved. This is because there are two {{<input>}} fields with the name {{comment_0}}.

!html.jpg!

I couldn't replicate with a standalone instance of Confluence 3.0.0_01.
fields.summary: When uploading attachments to Confluence, comments are not saved.
Create functional tests for new jira workflow that includes bamboo and crucible steps
Investigate Future license
Update all licenses for studio instances to renew FE license.
After upgrading to latest velocity-template Bamboo navbar is rendered as escaped html

fields.description: It would be great to be able to easily add custom fields and modify email notifications.
fields.summary: Customize notification email template

fields.description:
Add new studio build with parameter  {{-Dstudio.bamboo.enabled=false}}

Mark tests that test bamboo with "bamboo-only" group
fields.summary: Setup functional test for studio without the bamboo

fields.description:
Studio is currently running an old 2.0.0 version of SAL. 
For bamboo integration we need latest 2.0.13 version. 
I tried to quickly change it but too many test broke.
fields.summary: Upgrade to latest version of sal

fields.description:
A customer reports:

bq. We would like the ability to control the subjects and from addresses used by FishEye and Crucible. As separate applications, you can control these things, but they are not exposed as configuration settings once they are bundled into Studio. Please consider investigating the work required to expose these application configuration settings within the appropriate sections of the JIRA Studio configuration.
fields.summary: Allow users to control the e-mail settings for FishEye and Crucible
Create Bamboo project when studio project is created

fields.description: Not sure if this is mean to be a system-administrator only permission or not, but administrators can see and update the Source Configuration when using a direct link to the URL, but the menu item is hidden from their view.
fields.summary: In Source admin, the Source Configuration menu item is only visible to system-administrators, but users in the administrators group can still access the page using direct URL
Write func tests for Bamboo Browse History

fields.description:
Confluence 3 has lots of links in the user drop-down:

!confdropdown.png!

In Studio none of these appear:

!studiodropdown.png!

This means most of the new 3.0 functionality is effectively invisible, and many user-specific things are hard to get to.  Specifically:

| "Update Status" |  not accessible from anywhere else |
| "Personal Space" or "Create Personal Space" if the user doesn't have one  | "Personal space goes to {{/display/~<username>}}. There are no other links to this except if the user happens to make an update that appears on the recent activity list. If the user doesn't have a personal space, they can't create one. |
| "Recently Viewed" | Unnecessary due to Studio's 'History' tab |
| "Profile" |  Still accessible by clicking Profile, then "Wiki Preferences". Which is completely unintuitive, because one's profile does not just contain "preferences", but also the user's activity, network, status updates, labels, watches and drafts. |
| Network | only accessible through Profile -> Wiki Preferences -> Network |
| Status Updates | " |
| Labels | " |
| Watches | " |
| Drafts | " |
| Settings | " |
fields.summary: Confluence links from user drop-down missing
Fisheye problems with JSP Compiler breaking crucible reviews

fields.description:
The JIRA Fisheye plugin adds a line to the project administration section:

Repository Path:  None ( Select Path ) 

This lets one specify a path within a Fisheye repository to be associated with a project. For most projects this will be "/". Having this set will show all changesets under source tab of the JIRA panel (rather than just changes with issue keys in the message).
fields.summary: Default Repository Path to "/"

fields.description:
When I get a review start notification email, the in-reply-to header refers to an email that does not exist (I assert).

For example:

Date: Mon, 10 Aug 2009 15:26:29 -0700 (PDT)
To: stephen@bizo.com
Message-ID: <3885252.8631249943189869.JavaMail.jira@bizodev.jira.com>
In-Reply-To: <r176.d1249943138484@cruciblethreadindicator>
References: <r176.d1249943138484@cruciblethreadindicator>
Subject: [CR-CMNBLD-4] Review:  Use per-stage security groups.
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
X-Mailer: Cenqua-Crucible

CR-CMNBLD-4 state changed to Review by Stephen Haberman

...rest of body...

All of the email notifications from this review, CR-CMNBLD-4, will use the "In-Reply-To: r176.d1249943138484@cruciblethreadindicator". However, I've never gotten this message, so my mail client has no root to start threading the messages off of.

Can the first code review email have no In-Reply-To, and then subsequent review email notifications (for that review) refer to the first email's message-id? That would allow mail clients to actually make sense of the message-id/in-reply-to chain and thread them properly.

Thanks.

(Sorry about the label, but you guys suggested it.)
fields.summary: first email in code review refers to non-existent message-id

fields.description: enable GH custom ranking field by default
fields.summary: enable GH custom ranking field by default

The 'Administration' link that should be under the username drop-down, isn't present n Fisheye:

!noadmin.png!

It is present when on the Issues and Wiki tabs.
fields.summary: No 'administration' link in Fisheye

fields.description: The per-user activity stream (https://$host.jira.com.com/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=$user) is not showing any commit activity from Fisheye, just JIRA and Confluence activity.

fields.description:
Confluence 3.0.0_01 has a bug where attachments are going missing after moving pages around. 
I can't find the CONF number but according to Paul Curren and Anatoli, it should be fixed in 3.0.1.

See also AOD-1770
fields.summary: Upgrade to Confluence 3.0.1

fields.description: When viewing a jira issue in greenhopper, the "close" button is underneath the jira studio user/history buttons, making it impossible to click
fields.summary: Unable to click "close" when viewing jira issue in greenhopper

fields.description:
When a file normally viewed in MS Office (.doc, .docx, .xls, .xlsx etc) is clicked on using IE 7 or 8,  IE fails with an error:

"Internet Explorer cannot download <name> from <host>.
Internet Explorer was not able to open this Internet site.  The requested site is either unavailable or cannot be found.  Please try again later."

!ie7attachmentsfail.png!

This only seems to happen when the Studio instance is running over HTTPS.
fields.summary: Microsoft attachments (Word docs, Excel spreadsheets etc) fail to open in IE when site uses https

fields.description: While it is possible to change JIRA, Confluence and Fisheye permissions to restrict visibility to certain groups, we have no administrative interface for adjusting Crucible permission schemes.  The default Crucible scheme allows all logged-in users to see a project's reviews.  This means Crucible reviews are showing up in the activity stream of users who shouldn't be seeing it.
fields.summary: No way to hide Crucible reviews from certain users

fields.description:
Once 1.8.1 is ready to release, please verify that JIRA plugins are persisted.
Can do this probably by installing a plugin on test.jira.com, applying upgrade, and seeing what happens.
I thought it was working, but recently had some doubt due to a plugin not working across an upgrade.
fields.summary: verify JIRA plugins are persisted across upgrades

fields.description:
Verify plugins are on latest version - upgrade where necessary.
This should be done for every major release, starting with 1.8.1 then 1.9 then 2.0.
Doesn't matter to me whether you keep this ticket open and move from version to version, or add to checklist of release steps, but we need to make sure it happens.

Also make sure that the list of bundled plugins on http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/JIRA+Studio+Plugin+Policy is up-to-date.
fields.summary: The build should verify that bundled plugins are on latest version

fields.description:
Subversion 1.6.3 is now available in the CentOS repository, providing some useful improvements:

http://subversion.tigris.org/svn_1.6_releasenotes.html#tree-conflicts
http://subversion.tigris.org/svn_1.6_releasenotes.html#sparse-directory-exclusion

http://svn.collab.net/repos/svn/trunk/CHANGES

Upgrading would likely require running 'svnadmin upgrade' on the repositories.
fields.summary: Upgrade to Subversion 1.6 when available

fields.description:
I can't figure out a way to create my personal space.
Douglas has one: http://presales.jira.com/wiki/display/~dbutler/Home

It is also not listed as a restricted function in Studio: http://tr.im/uaBU

Is this a bug or am I missing something?

Confluence's drop-down menus ("Add" and "Tools") are half broken in IE 7/8, and throw Javascript errors.  Just moving the cursor over the menu (so the drop-down appears) triggers a JS error box saying

Error: 'AJS.dropDown.current' is null or not an object

fields.description: In Studio apps there are applinks for Fisheye *and* Subversion.  I can see the point of the Fisheye applink (determines what the 'Source' tab points to), but the Subversion applink seems totally pointless.  Studio doesn't use it, and even if it needed to know the Subversion path it can get it from Fisheye (as the permission manager code does).  Besides which, [synchronizing it breaks|https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AOD-1748].
fields.summary: Get rid of the 'Subversion' applink

fields.description:
When the pager tries to display many links, it overlaps the title and generally looks ugly:

https://studio.atlassian.com/source/profile/editDisplaySettings-default.do

fields.description: We have the JIRA Labels plugin bundled by default, but 'deactivated'. Due to a JIRA classloading problem, just 'activating' the plugin causes it to fail silently (AOD-1746) until JIRA is restarted (much like Greenhopper in AOD-1366).  We should rather have the plugin activated by default (it's a supported plugin), and leave users to configure the custom field if they actually want it.
fields.summary: Activate JIRA Labels plugin by default

fields.description:
Confluence theme files seem to be quite outdated and it's not obvious what gets customised. It makes it hard to upgrade to new versions of Confluence.
* clean up confluence theme files
* add original files for each modified one so we can easily compare the files and see modifications.
fields.summary: Clean up confluence theme

fields.description:
In 1.8 there is a new "Synchronize" link for the Subversion applink, eg:

Subversion Repository: BINKY (svn)  ( Select  | Synchronize  ) 

Clicking it results in a stacktrace:



java.lang.IllegalStateException: unsupported protocol: 'file'
	at org.apache.commons.httpclient.protocol.Protocol.lazyRegisterProtocol(Protocol.java:148)
	at org.apache.commons.httpclient.protocol.Protocol.getProtocol(Protocol.java:116)
	at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpHost.<init>(HttpHost.java:106)
	at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodBase.setURI(HttpMethodBase.java:276)
	at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodBase.<init>(HttpMethodBase.java:217)
	at org.apache.commons.httpclient.methods.ExpectContinueMethod.<init>(ExpectContinueMethod.java:92)
	at org.apache.commons.httpclient.methods.EntityEnclosingMethod.<init>(EntityEnclosingMethod.java:118)
	at org.apache.commons.httpclient.methods.PostMethod.<init>(PostMethod.java:105)
	at com.atlassian.sal.core.net.HttpClientRequest.makeMethod(HttpClientRequest.java:358)
	at com.atlassian.sal.core.net.HttpClientRequest.execute(HttpClientRequest.java:232)
	at com.atlassian.sal.core.net.HttpClientRequest.execute(HttpClientRequest.java:326)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.EditProjectLinks.doSynchronize(EditProjectLinks.java:146)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
...

It makes no sense to "synchronize" with Subversion, so I think the link was added by accident during the recent UI change.
fields.summary: Synchronizing Subversion results in stacktrace

fields.description:
In Firefox 3.5 the Issues tab appears about 1cm higher than all the others.

fields.description:
The JIRA Labels plugin displays a [EDIT] link on the View page:

!jiralabels.png!

When clicked, a form is meant to appear in which the user enters label.  In Studio nothing happens.
fields.summary: JIRA Labels plugin is broken (cannot add labels on View screen)

fields.description:
Trying to save any edits to the Confluence General Configuration page results in an error:

{quote}The following error(s) occurred:

    * Your request could not be processed because a required security token was not present in the request. You may need to re-submit the form or reload the page.
{quote}

!brokengeneralconfig.png!
fields.summary: Cannot edit Confluence General Configuration

fields.description:
When editing a page, Confluence usually displays a notation guide on the right-hand side. This is useful for reminding people of basic markup, and links to the full notation guide for more complex use:

!notationguide.png!

In Studio 1.8 this is missing:

!editpage.png!

It was present in 1.7.1.1, so it seems we broke it when upgrading to Confluence 3.
fields.summary: Confluence notation guide is missing

fields.description:
In Greenhopper it is possible to set which projects Greenhopper is available for:

!gh_setprojects.png!

In Studio, submitting this form doesn't work. The screen just refreshes with no projects selected.
fields.summary: Restricting Greenhopper to particular projects doesn't work

fields.description:
If for some reason a user doesn't exist, Studio 1.8.0.1 blows up with:

{noformat}
java.lang.NullPointerException
at com.atlassian.studio.history.JiraBrowseHistoryManager$3.get(JiraBrowseHistoryManager.java:118)
at com.atlassian.studio.history.JiraBrowseHistoryManager.visitBrowseHistory(JiraBrowseHistoryManager.java:160)
at com.atlassian.studio.history.JiraBrowseHistoryManager.collectHistory(JiraBrowseHistoryManager.java:81)
at com.atlassian.studio.history.JiraBrowseHistoryManager.put(JiraBrowseHistoryManager.java:195)
at com.atlassian.studio.history.JiraBrowseHistory.addIssue(JiraBrowseHistory.java:59)
at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.IssueActionSupport.setCurrentIssue(IssueActionSupport.java:145)
at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.AbstractIssueSelectAction.getIssue(AbstractIssueSelectAction.java:81)
at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.ViewIssue.doExecute(ViewIssue.java:156)
at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:153)
at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport.java:54)
at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:132)
at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraServletDispatcher.service(JiraServletDispatcher.java:178)
at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:803)
...
{noformat}

The problem is in JiraBrowseHistoryManager.java, where getUserBrowseHistorySettings() calls getUserSettings() and doesn't handle case when it returns null.

fields.description: Currently the jiraissues macro is far too wide (http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-12571).  This was actually fixed in the plugin, but Studio uses a version from Nov 2008 marked 'outdated' in the plugin repository.

fields.description: For example, quick search for '123' causes error because its looking for a JIRA issue key. Correct behavior should be to perform normal search if key search has zero results.
fields.summary: quick searching for a number causes error

fields.description:
Many customer's projects in Subversion do not conform to the usual trunk/tags/branches structure.  For these, Studio still displays the now-incorrect message:

This project is using Subversion. You may check out the source code by running:
  svn checkout https://<host>.jira.com/svn/qa/trunk QA --username sysadmin


Fisheye caters for this by letting the admin specify regexes identifying the logical 'trunk', branches, tags etc.  The code that displays this text should ask Fisheye what the logical 'trunk' directory is, rather than just hardcode /trunk.  If there is no logical trunk (the 'Custom' scheme in Fisheye) then either don't print anything, or tell the user to pick a directory to check out from the list in Fisheye.
fields.summary: Subversion checkout instructions are often wrong and misleading

fields.description: Studio was built assuming that there would be one top-level directory in Subversion per project.  It has become increasingly apparent that this is unworkable.  Many customers come to Studio with an existing Subversion repository that rarely conforms to our assumption.  For these customers we need to manually create Fisheye projects and map them to JIRA projects.  Any subsequent adjustments can only be done by Atlassian through raising a support request.  JIRA creates top-level directories that don't conform to the pattern and so simply go unused and clutter the repository.
fields.summary: Allow arbitrary Subversion directories to be mapped to projects

fields.description:
Latest balsamiq mockups plugin for confluence only allows users to edit pages if they are in the balsamiq-mockups-editors group. When we update to this plugin we will need to add an upgrade task to add everyone to this group.

See also: http://www.balsamiq.com/blog/2008/07/29/licensing-changes-for-mockups-for-confluence/
fields.summary: Add upgrade task to put all users into the "balsamiq-mockups-editors" group

fields.description:
To replicate:
 - Go to the Studio Group Browser
 - Create a group
 - Delete the group

The deleted group still displays in the Group Browser.  Trying to delete it again will result in the error:

  Exception trying to remove group: com.opensymphony.user.ImmutableException

and a stacktrace:

2009-06-30 10:57:51.892058500 2009-06-30 10:57:51,890 TP-Processor1 ERROR [jira.bc.group.DefaultGroupService] Exception trying to remove group: com.opensymphony.user.ImmutableException
2009-06-30 10:57:51.892061500 com.opensymphony.user.ImmutableException
2009-06-30 10:57:51.892062500   at com.opensymphony.user.Group.remove(Group.java:152)
2009-06-30 10:57:51.892063500   at com.atlassian.core.user.GroupUtils.removeGroup(GroupUtils.java:211)
2009-06-30 10:57:51.892065500   at com.atlassian.jira.bc.group.DefaultGroupService.removeGroup(DefaultGroupService.java:806)
2009-06-30 10:57:51.892116500   at com.atlassian.jira.bc.group.DefaultGroupService.delete(DefaultGroupService.java:184)
2009-06-30 10:57:51.892118500   at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.user.DeleteGroup.doExecute(DeleteGroup.java:66)
2009-06-30 10:57:51.892119500   at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.user.StudioDeleteGroup.doExecute(StudioDeleteGroup.java:61)
2009-06-30 10:57:51.892120500   at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:153)
2009-06-30 10:57:51.892129500   at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport.java:54)
2009-06-30 10:57:51.892130500   at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:132)


likewise trying to add users to the group fails:

java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException: Could not add user: sysadmin to group: testgroup
	at com.atlassian.jira.user.util.UserUtilImpl.addUserToGroup(UserUtilImpl.java:91)
	at com.atlassian.jira.user.util.UserUtilImpl.addUserToGroup(UserUtilImpl.java:80)
	at com.atlassian.jira.user.util.UserUtilImpl.addUserToGroups(UserUtilImpl.java:108)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.group.DefaultGroupService.addUsersToGroups(DefaultGroupService.java:319)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.user.BulkEditUserGroups.doExecute(BulkEditUserGroups.java:114)
	at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:153)


The group is actually deleted from Crowd, and restarting JIRA makes it properly disappear.
fields.summary: Deleted mixed-case groups loitering in JIRA, throwing ImmutableExceptions and causing trouble

fields.description: I would like to be able to configure Jira Studio to automatically send an email reminder (or maybe an in-system notification) to specific user groups on specific projects, every business day at the end of the workday, if they haven't logged any time against an issue during that day.
fields.summary: Automatically send/display reminders daily at a specified time, if no hours logged against a task.

fields.description:
On instances where collaborators are disabled (using the studio.external.crowd=true flag, for example, http://open.jira.com), an attempt to edit users by an administrator will fail saying that no license type was specified.  The license type field is disabled, but the validation is not.  This field should only be validated if collaborator licensing is enabled.

A user can however edit themselves using the edit profile screen.
fields.summary: Editing user fails when collaborators disabled

fields.description: Currently in JIRA Studio if you svn commit and your log message references the wrong issue you're stuck. Although you can use revprop to update the log message, you cannot ask Fisheye to re-index. It would be great if we could get this functionality in JIRA Studio (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Indexer).
fields.summary: Make Fisheye's indexer functionality available

fields.description:
There's a new Atom-based format for Activity Streams being adopted in the public web. It's been implemented by Facebook, MySpace and others.

It looks like a fairly sane way to implement streams within Atom, and has fallback mechanisms for readers/processors that don't understand the semantics of the activity entries.

[Details here|http://activitystrea.ms/].
fields.summary: Support emerging activity streams format

fields.description:
Most people work within the context of a specific project. This means when doing a search, they usually only want search results from that project.

Studio's Quicksearch, like JIRA's, ignores the currently selected project and searches over everything.  We should change it to search just the current project (if set).  If the user really wants to search everything, that can be done on drop-down in the search page.
fields.summary: Quicksearch should restrict results to currently selected project

fields.description: Similar to [this|http://tr.im/oZTT].

fields.description:
When a review is created in Studio 1.7.7.1, the activity stream item reports the wrong user as the review creator.  It reports the author of the reviewed Subversion commit, rather than the person who actually created the review.

Eg. in this screenshot, "System Administrator" actually created the review.

!as.png!
fields.summary: Create Review actions in activity stream attributed to code author, not review creator

fields.description:
Our bamboo builds still take too long.

Find out if we can upgrade to milestone version of Bamboo 2.3. It should properly manage dependency builds.  
Investigate if we can split functional tests and run them simultaneously using multiple agents or EC2.
fields.summary: Upgrade Bamboo builds
